page.title: 04Local Customs
page.content: Every year in April,Brigadier Crawford holds a Daffodil Tea in the grounds of his home at Naughton.Naughton House is the largest house in the area and is the focal point for Naughton Estate.Flags flank the drive and adults pay 50pence and children 20pence on entry.When you go up to the house there are lots of stalls.You can look around the ruined castle and admire the garden covered in daffodils.Sandwiches and cakes are served in the house.This annual event attracts most of the villagers and the money raised goes towards the upkeep of the village hall.
